channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Survey of Large Language Models
item.description: To discriminate the difference in parameter scale, the research community has coined the term large language models (LLM) for the PLMs of significant size.

item.title: Focused Transformer: Contrastive Training for Context Scaling
item.description: This novel approach enhances the structure of the (key, value) space, enabling an extension of the context length.

item.title: Semantic-SAM: Segment and Recognize Anything at Any Granularity
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Semantic-SAM, a universal image segmentation model to enable segment and recognize anything at any desired granularity.

item.title: DragDiffusion: Harnessing Diffusion Models for Interactive Point-based Image Editing
item.description: In this work, we extend such an editing framework to diffusion models and propose DragDiffusion.

item.title: h2oGPT: Democratizing Large Language Models
item.description: Applications built on top of Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT-4 represent a revolution in AI due to their human-level capabilities in natural language processing.

item.title: A Survey on Evaluation of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are gaining increasing popularity in both academia and industry, owing to their unprecedented performance in various applications.

item.title: FreeDrag: Point Tracking is Not You Need for Interactive Point-based Image Editing
item.description: To serve the intricate and varied demands of image editing, precise and flexible manipulation of image content is indispensable.

item.title: ChatLaw: Open-Source Legal Large Language Model with Integrated External Knowledge Bases
item.description: Furthermore, we propose a self-attention method to enhance the ability of large models to overcome errors present in reference data, further optimizing the issue of model hallucinations at the model level and improving the problem-solving capabilities of large models.

item.title: Segment Anything Meets Point Tracking
item.description: SAM-PT leverages robust and sparse point selection and propagation techniques for mask generation, demonstrating that a SAM-based segmentation tracker can yield strong zero-shot performance across popular video object segmentation benchmarks, including DAVIS, YouTube-VOS, and MOSE.

item.title: A Survey on Graph Neural Networks for Time Series: Forecasting, Classification, Imputation, and Anomaly Detection
item.description: In this survey, we provide a comprehensive review of graph neural networks for time series analysis (GNN4TS), encompassing four fundamental dimensions: Forecasting, classification, anomaly detection, and imputation.

item.title: DragonDiffusion: Enabling Drag-style Manipulation on Diffusion Models
item.description: Specifically, we construct classifier guidance based on the strong correspondence of intermediate features in the diffusion model.

item.title: MME: A Comprehensive Evaluation Benchmark for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Multimodal Large Language Model (MLLM) relies on the powerful LLM to perform multimodal tasks, showing amazing emergent abilities in recent studies, such as writing poems based on an image.

item.title: SDXL: Improving Latent Diffusion Models for High-Resolution Image Synthesis
item.description: We present SDXL, a latent diffusion model for text-to-image synthesis.

item.title: RLTF: Reinforcement Learning from Unit Test Feedback
item.description: To address these issues, we proposed RLTF, i. e., Reinforcement Learning from Unit Test Feedback, a novel online RL framework with unit test feedback of multi-granularity for refining code LLMs.

item.title: GPT4RoI: Instruction Tuning Large Language Model on Region-of-Interest
item.description: The interleaved sequences of visual features extracted by the spatial instruction and the language embedding are input to LLM, and trained on the transformed region-text data in instruction tuning format.

item.title: GLM-130B: An Open Bilingual Pre-trained Model
item.description: We introduce GLM-130B, a bilingual (English and Chinese) pre-trained language model with 130 billion parameters.

item.title: Shikra: Unleashing Multimodal LLM's Referential Dialogue Magic
item.description: Referential dialogue is a superset of various vision-language (VL) tasks.

item.title: mPLUG-DocOwl: Modularized Multimodal Large Language Model for Document Understanding
item.description: Nevertheless, without in-domain training, these models tend to ignore fine-grained OCR features, such as sophisticated tables or large blocks of text, which are essential for OCR-free document understanding.

item.title: WizardCoder: Empowering Code Large Language Models with Evol-Instruct
item.description: Moreover, our model even outperforms the largest closed LLMs, Anthropic's Claude and Google's Bard, on HumanEval and HumanEval+.

item.title: LLaMA-Adapter V2: Parameter-Efficient Visual Instruction Model
item.description: This strategy effectively alleviates the interference between the two tasks of image-text alignment and instruction following and achieves strong multi-modal reasoning with only a small-scale image-text and instruction dataset.
